{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic inflammatory disorder that can affect more than just your joints. In some people, the condition can damage a wide variety of body systems, including the skin, eyes, lungs, heart and blood vessels. When it affects the Temporomandibular joint (TMJ), it can lead to various complications. Ankylosis refers to stiffness or fixation of the joint, which can occur due to the chronic inflammation and damage caused by rheumatoid arthritis. Synovial chondromatosis is a rare disease that occurs when the synovium grows abnormally and produces nodules made of cartilage. Subluxation refers to partial dislocation which is not common in rheumatoid arthritis. Osteoarthritis is a type of arthritis that occurs when flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down which is a different condition from rheumatoid arthritis. Therefore, the most common complication following rheumatoid arthritis of the TMJ is likely to be Ankylosis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
